items.title: Is free will an illusion?
items.author: Closer To Truth
items.content: Astrobiologist and theoretical physicist Sara Imari Walker discusses free will as a real physical property. Watch the full interview on our YouTube channel here: https://t.ly/JsjtY #shorts

items.title: Peter Forrest - Pantheism: Is God All Reality?
items.author: Closer To Truth
items.content:
Make a tax-deductible donation to support Closer To Truth's mission of exploring the world's deepest questions around the globe: https://shorturl.at/OnyRq

Is our search for God too narrow? Why do some philosophers espouse ‘pantheism’? Pantheism’s claim is not shy: God is the Cosmos and the Cosmos is God. But does re-naming all-that-exists ‘God’ add understanding? Can the new name make the world ‘sacred’? What is gained, and what is lost, if a theist becomes a pantheist?

Get special exclusives and discounts with a free Closer To Truth membership today: https://closertotruth.com/.

Peter Forrest teaches the areas of Epistemology and Metaphysics at the University of New England. He works in the area of the philosophy of physics, epistemology, the philosophy of religion, and other issues in metaphysics and epistemology.

Closer To Truth, hosted by Robert Lawrence Kuhn and directed by Peter Getzels, presents the world’s greatest thinkers exploring humanity’s deepest questions. Discover fundamental issues of existence. Engage new and diverse ways of thinking. Appreciate intense debates. Share your own opinions. Seek your own answers.

items.title: Walter Sinnott-Armstrong - Neuroscience and the Human Mind
items.author: Closer To Truth
items.content:
Donate to Closer To Truth and help us keep our content free and without paywalls: https://shorturl.at/OnyRq

Society is composed of human minds working collectively. By appreciating consciousness can we understand society better? Conversely, by appreciating society can we understand consciousness better? What’s the relationship between society and consciousness? Can we have either without the other? Or are they inextricably bound together?

Follow Closer To Truth on Instagram for news, announcements, and exciting updates: https://shorturl.at/p2IhM

Walter Sinnott-Armstrong is an American philosopher specializing in ethics, epistemology, neuroethics, the philosophy of law, and the philosophy of cognitive science. He is the Chauncey Stillman Professor of Practical Ethics in the Department of Philosophy and the Kenan Institute for Ethics at Duke University.

items.title: Huston Smith - What is God Like?
items.author: Closer To Truth
items.content:
Are you a Closer to Truth member? Register for a free account to receive special exclusives today: https://closertotruth.com/.

What can we know about God? The easy answer is ‘nothing’: God is not like anything. Finite humans cannot know an infinite God. But that’s not good enough. If there is a God, God must have traits, attributes, characteristics. More deeply, God should have an ‘essence’, a nature. We must be able to say something about God. At least we must try.

Support the show with a donation of any amount to help Closer To Truth continue exploring life's deepest questions: shorturl.at/OnyRq

Huston Cummings Smith was a scholar of religious studies in the United States, He authored at least thirteen books on world's religions and philosophy, and his book about comparative religion, The World's Religions sold over three million copies as of 2017.

Follow us on X for daily news, announcements, and more: https://x.com/CloserToTruth

items.title: Anjan Chatterjee - Can Neuroscience Help Us Understand Art?
items.author: Closer To Truth
items.content:
Use code THANKSCTT to get 20% off Closer To Truth merch: https://bit.ly/3P2ogje

Make a donation to Closer To Truth to help us continue exploring the world's deepest questions without the need for paywalls: https://shorturl.at/OnyRq

What is the nature of art? What makes something “art”, and why should we value it? What are aesthetics and art theory? How is the philosophy of art (or aesthetics) relevant to the study, appreciation, and practice of the arts?

Follow us on X for announcements, news, updates, and more: https://x.com/CloserToTruth

Anjan Chatterjee is a professor of neurology, psychology, and architecture at the University of Pennsylvania.

items.title: Elizabeth Loftus - Can Our Memories be Manipulated?
items.author: Closer To Truth
items.content:
Subscribe to the Closer To Truth podcast on Apple, Spotify, or wherever you listen: https://shorturl.at/mtJP4

Why do people believe the things they do? We like to think that we are rational, that what we believe is true. But often we come to our beliefs, unknowingly, as a product of our particular ‘belief systems’. How do belief systems work their credulous magic? What principles enable belief systems to influence individuals and commandeer groups?

Follow Closer To Truth on Instagram for news, event discounts, and exciting updates: https://www.instagram.com/closertotruth/

Elizabeth F. Loftus is an American psychologist who is best known in relation to the misinformation effect, false memory and criticism of recovered memory therapies.

Support Closer To Truth with a tax-deductible donation of any amount: https://shorturl.at/OnyRq

items.title: Michael Almeida - Is This the Best of All Possible Worlds?
items.author: Closer To Truth
items.content:
Like us on Facebook for daily videos, announcements, and more: https://www.facebook.com/CloserToTruthTV

Is this a joke? Our world, with its vast evils, the ‘best possible world’? It seems absurd. Yet some do claim that ultimately our world will be the best possible world, because the sum total of all the good, primarily generated by human free will and divine providence, will overpower all the obvious evils. Perhaps the calculus should include the entire cosmos?

Do you have a Closer to Truth membership? Register for a free account to receive special exclusives today: https://closertotruth.com/.

Mike Almeida is Professor of Philosophy and chair of the Department of Philosophy and Classics at the University of Texas at San Antonio.

items.title: Richard Dawkins - Evolution, Inheritance, and Biology
items.author: Closer To Truth
items.content:
Giving Tuesday is this week! Make a donation of any amount to help support Closer To Truth: https://shorturl.at/OnyRq

What is the extended evolutionary synthesis (EES) and why better? Includes multilevel selection, transgenerational epigenetic inheritance, niche construction, evolvability, and ideas from evolutionary developmental biology. Why is EES controversial?

items.title: Is Life After Death Possible?
items.author: Closer To Truth
items.content:
Does everything about a person disappear at death? The body? Sure, it's gone. The brain? It stops working, then dissolves. But what about awareness? Does our consciousness end forever? Nothing could be more frightening! Is there any hope? Are there ways that, conceivably, our consciousness can survive the ultimate insult?

Watch our full interview with Sam Parnia here: https://t.ly/DZlGS #shorts

items.title: Nancey Murphy - What Gives Us Personal Identity?
items.author: Closer To Truth
items.content:
Get 20% off your Closer To Truth merch purchase with code THANKSCTT at checkout: https://bit.ly/3P2ogje

What makes one a person or a self? If he or she sees, hears, thinks and feels, is that a person or a self? How can separate perceptions bind together into a coherent mental unity of a single person or self? And how does personhood or self persist through time? If persons are all material, what enables the continuity? Is there a ‘carrier’ of personal identity?

Subscribe to the Closer To Truth podcast on Apple, Spotify, or wherever you listen: https://shorturl.at/mtJP4

items.title: Your Gift Means the World
items.author: Closer To Truth
items.content:
For over 20 years, Closer To Truth has explored humanity’s deepest questions in the fields of cosmos, life, mind, and meaning. 

But there’s a new question we need to explore: What comes next? 

Closer to Truth has just launched our first-ever donation platform. Every tax-deductible donation—big or small—helps us share fresh, transformative perspectives on questions that have shaped human thought for millennia.

We want to continue breaking new ground and conducting interviews with top thinkers and scientists who do the same.

Give what you can today: https://shorturl.at/nzbqn

Thank you.

items.title: E. Thomas Lawson - Art and Cognitive Science
items.author: Closer To Truth
items.content:
Today is #givingtuesday — support Closer To Truth with a tax-deductible donation of any amount: https://shorturl.at/OnyRq

Make a donation to Closer To Truth to help us continue exploring the world's deepest questions without the need for paywalls: https://shorturl.at/OnyRq

Aesthetic Cognitivism is a theory about the arts as sources of understanding. What are the scholarly or scientific fields that form its foundation? Explore art’s relationship with cognitive science, philosophy, neuroscience, history, theology and religion.

Are you a Closer To Truth member? Register for a free account to get special exclusives and discounts at https://closertotruth.com/.

Ernest Thomas Lawson is an honorary professor at the Institute of Cognition and Culture at Queen’s University Belfast. He is the executive editor of the Journal of Cognition and Culture and co-founder of the North American Association for the Study of Religion. He is a founding member and has served as the first President of the International Association for the Cognitive Science of Religion.

Follow Closer To Truth on X for articles, videos, updates, and more: https://x.com/CloserToTruth

items.title: Andrew Pinsent - The Big Bang and the Structure of Reality
items.author: Closer To Truth
items.content:
Donate to Closer To Truth this holiday season and help us keep our content free and without paywalls: https://shorturl.at/OnyRq

How do physicists and philosophers who believe in God harmonize the discoveries of cosmology with the doctrine of creation? How does cosmology enhance or erode their belief in God? If God exists, must the universe have had a beginning? Conversely, if the universe had a beginning, must God exist?

Follow Closer To Truth on Instagram for news, announcements, and exciting updates: https://shorturl.at/p2IhM

Fr. Andrew Pinsent is professor of theology and philosophy at the Athenaeum of Ohio in Cincinnati, Ohio, and a Catholic priest of the Diocese of Arundel and Brighton in England.

items.author: Closer To Truth
items.content:

Explore the process of science with the content of biology. Life’s nature and structure. Evolution’s challenges. Examine race, sex and gender, cognition, culture, morality, religion, alien life, and more.

Paul Griffiths is Professor of Philosophy at the University of Sydney and works primarily in the Philosophy of Science and more particularly Philosophy of Biology.
